intro: Valeriana armena, commonly known as Armenian valerian, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly rough texture and emits a subtle, herbal fragrance. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Valeriana armena is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its calming properties.
